title: Mantrac to hold power solution seminar
text:
8 September 2015 17:00 CET Mantrac to hold power solution seminar By GNA 
Accra, Sept. 08, GNA - Mantrac Ghana Limited, sole authorized dealer of Caterpillar (CAT) products in the country is to hold a Power Solution Seminar to sensitize the public on latest power conservation technologies. 
The day's session, set to take place in Accra on September 15, is expected to bring together over 100 customers who would receive advice from Mantrac experts on how to use new CAT models of power generators and hybrid solutions using latest solar and energy storage technologies. 
Mr Daniel A. Pabby, Head of Marketing and Strategic Planning at Mantrac Ghana, told journalists that Mantrac over the past year has supplied and supported very major power supply projects in the country with its trusted CAT branded diesel power generating sets. 
Caterpillar for more than 85 years has been providing power to customers in various industries including hotels, mining, banking, telecom, schools and many more. 
Mr Pabby said the company has succeeded in closing major power deals, like the recent 5.8 Mega Watts diesel power generator deal with Persus Mining, to boost its on-site power generating capacity at its Edikan Gold Mine ("Edikan"). 
He said: 'we are constantly improving our products offerings to suit various applications in our markets of operations, this calls for frequent engagements with our customers to keep them up to date.' 
The seminar is the first of its kind and would be used to build customer loyalty as well as give opportunity for customers to interact with Mantrac and caterpillar experts on running very efficient power generating systems. 
The seminar is expected to help customers to understand the various levels of Mantrac's equipment management support solutions and also gain more light on CAT Finance collaboration with Stanbic Bank Ghana.
